citation.fr: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"65931687-684a-41b5-9aa5-086a9e72b5c5\", \"author\": [{\"literal\": \"Government of Newfoundland and Labrador's Department of Municipal Affairs and Environment\"}, {\"literal\": \"NEGL at Queen's University\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2024\", \"11\", \"19\"]}], \"abstract\": \"NEGL - Postville, Nunatsiavut (NLQU0001). Les m\u00e2ts de tour \u00e0 trois pattes mesurent 25 pieds de hauteur (7,62 m) et les stations sont toutes situ\u00e9es \u00e0 mi-pentes en terrain d\u00e9gag\u00e9. Les sites de Cartwright Junction, pr\u00e8s de Red Bay et de North West River comprennent tous des cl\u00f4tures qui peuvent avoir une incidence sur l'accumulation de neige \u00e0 ces sites. Toutes les stations sont d\u00e9tenues et exploit\u00e9es par le Laboratoire g\u00e9oscientifique de l'environnement du Nord dirig\u00e9 par Robert Way. Toutes les stations ont \u00e9t\u00e9 \u00e9tablies en partenariat avec les collectivit\u00e9s de Black Tickle, North West River, Postville, Red Bay et Rigolet. Le soutien de ce projet a \u00e9t\u00e9 re\u00e7u du Labrador Institute of Memorial University of Newfoundland, du gouvernement du Nunatsiavut, du NunatuKavut Community Council, du minist\u00e8re des P\u00eaches et des Ressources fonci\u00e8res et du minist\u00e8re des Affaires municipales et de l'Environnement du gouvernement de Terre-Neuve-et-Labrador et du minist\u00e8re des Affaires municipales et de l'Environnement, et Queen's University. Le financement de ce projet a \u00e9t\u00e9 re\u00e7u de la Couronne-Autochtones et du Nord Canada (gouvernement du Canada) dans le cadre du Programme de surveillance du climat ax\u00e9 sur les collectivit\u00e9s autochtones. Les stations climatiques ont \u00e9t\u00e9 achet\u00e9es aupr\u00e8s de Forest Technology Systems Inc, dont le si\u00e8ge social est situ\u00e9 en Colombie-Britannique, au Canada.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"\", \"title\": \"NEGL, Postville, Nunatsiavut (NLQU0001)\", \"language\": \"fr\", \"URL\": \"https://catalogue.cioosatlantic.ca/dataset/65931687-684a-41b5-9aa5-086a9e72b5c5?local=fr\"}]
citation.en: [{\"type\": \"dataset\", \"id\": \"65931687-684a-41b5-9aa5-086a9e72b5c5\", \"author\": [{\"literal\": \"Government of Newfoundland and Labrador's Department of Municipal Affairs and Environment\"}, {\"literal\": \"NEGL at Queen's University\"}], \"issued\": [{\"date-parts\": [\"2024\", \"11\", \"19\"]}], \"abstract\": \"NEGL - Postville, Nunatsiavut (NLQU0001). Tri-leg tower masts are 25 feet tall (7.62 m) and stations are all located at mid-slopes in cleared terrain.  Sites at Cartwright Junction, near Red Bay and at North West River all include fence enclosures which may impact snow accumulation at these sites.  All stations are owned and operated by the Northern Environmental Geoscience Laboratory led by Dr. Robert Way. All stations were established in partnership with the communities of Black Tickle, North West River, Postville, Red Bay and Rigolet.  Support for this project was received from the Labrador Institute of Memorial University of Newfoundland, the Nunatsiavut Government, the NunatuKavut Community Council, the Government of Newfoundland and Labrador's Department of Fisheries and Land Resources & Department of Municipal Affairs and Environment, and Queen's University.  Funding for this project was received from Crown-Indigenous and Northern Affairs Canada (Government of Canada) through the Indigenous Community-Based Climate Monitoring Program. Climate stations were purchased from Forest Technology Systems Inc headquatered in British Columbia, Canada.\", \"edition\": \"\", \"edition-date\": \"\", \"publisher\": \"\", \"title\": \"NEGL, Postville, Nunatsiavut (NLQU0001)\", \"language\": \"en\", \"URL\": \"https://catalogue.cioosatlantic.ca/dataset/65931687-684a-41b5-9aa5-086a9e72b5c5?local=en\"}]

      <mri:abstract xsi:type="lan:PT_FreeText_PropertyType">
        <gco:CharacterString>NEGL - Postville, Nunatsiavut (NLQU0001). Tri-leg tower masts are 25 feet tall (7.62 m) and stations are all located at mid-slopes in cleared terrain.  Sites at Cartwright Junction, near Red Bay and at North West River all include fence enclosures which may impact snow accumulation at these sites.  All stations are owned and operated by the Northern Environmental Geoscience Laboratory led by Dr. Robert Way. All stations were established in partnership with the communities of Black Tickle, North West River, Postville, Red Bay and Rigolet.  Support for this project was received from the Labrador Institute of Memorial University of Newfoundland, the Nunatsiavut Government, the NunatuKavut Community Council, the Government of Newfoundland and Labrador's Department of Fisheries and Land Resources & Department of Municipal Affairs and Environment, and Queen's University.  Funding for this project was received from Crown-Indigenous and Northern Affairs Canada (Government of Canada) through the Indigenous Community-Based Climate Monitoring Program. Climate stations were purchased from Forest Technology Systems Inc headquatered in British Columbia, Canada.</gco:CharacterString>
        <lan:PT_FreeText>
          <lan:textGroup>
            <lan:LocalisedCharacterString locale="fra">NEGL - Postville, Nunatsiavut (NLQU0001). Les m\u00e2ts de tour \u00e0 trois pattes mesurent 25 pieds de hauteur (7,62 m) et les stations sont toutes situ\u00e9es \u00e0 mi-pentes en terrain d\u00e9gag\u00e9. Les sites de Cartwright Junction, pr\u00e8s de Red Bay et de North West River comprennent tous des cl\u00f4tures qui peuvent avoir une incidence sur l'accumulation de neige \u00e0 ces sites. Toutes les stations sont d\u00e9tenues et exploit\u00e9es par le Laboratoire g\u00e9oscientifique de l'environnement du Nord dirig\u00e9 par Robert Way. Toutes les stations ont \u00e9t\u00e9 \u00e9tablies en partenariat avec les collectivit\u00e9s de Black Tickle, North West River, Postville, Red Bay et Rigolet. Le soutien de ce projet a \u00e9t\u00e9 re\u00e7u du Labrador Institute of Memorial University of Newfoundland, du gouvernement du Nunatsiavut, du NunatuKavut Community Council, du minist\u00e8re des P\u00eaches et des Ressources fonci\u00e8res et du minist\u00e8re des Affaires municipales et de l'Environnement du gouvernement de Terre-Neuve-et-Labrador et du minist\u00e8re des Affaires municipales et de l'Environnement, et Queen's University. Le financement de ce projet a \u00e9t\u00e9 re\u00e7u de la Couronne-Autochtones et du Nord Canada (gouvernement du Canada) dans le cadre du Programme de surveillance du climat ax\u00e9 sur les collectivit\u00e9s autochtones. Les stations climatiques ont \u00e9t\u00e9 achet\u00e9es aupr\u00e8s de Forest Technology Systems Inc, dont le si\u00e8ge social est situ\u00e9 en Colombie-Britannique, au Canada.</lan:LocalisedCharacterString>
          </lan:textGroup>
        </lan:PT_FreeText>
      </mri:abstract>
      <mri:credit xsi:type="lan:PT_FreeText_PropertyType">
        <gco:CharacterString>The community of Postville, Labrador Institute of Memorial University of Newfoundland, the Nunatsiavut Government, the NunatuKavut Community Council, the Government of Newfoundland and Labrador's Department of Fisheries and Land Resources &amp; Department of Municipal Affairs and Environment, and Queen's University, Crown-Indigenous and Northern Affairs Canada (Government of Canada) through the Indigenous Community-Based Climate Monitoring Program, Forest Technology Systems Inc.</gco:CharacterString>
      </mri:credit>
      <mri:status>
        <mcc:MD_ProgressCode codeList="http://standards.iso.org/iso/19115/resources/Codelists/cat/codelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode" codeListValue="onGoing">
        </mcc:MD_ProgressCode>
      </mri:status>

      </mri:topicCategory>

name: 65931687-684a-41b5-9aa5-086a9e72b5c5
notes: NEGL - Postville, Nunatsiavut (NLQU0001). Tri-leg tower masts are 25 feet tall (7.62 m) and stations are all located at mid-slopes in cleared terrain.  Sites at Cartwright Junction, near Red Bay and at North West River all include fence enclosures which may impact snow accumulation at these sites.  All stations are owned and operated by the Northern Environmental Geoscience Laboratory led by Dr. Robert Way. All stations were established in partnership with the communities of Black Tickle, North West River, Postville, Red Bay and Rigolet.  Support for this project was received from the Labrador Institute of Memorial University of Newfoundland, the Nunatsiavut Government, the NunatuKavut Community Council, the Government of Newfoundland and Labrador's Department of Fisheries and Land Resources & Department of Municipal Affairs and Environment, and Queen's University.  Funding for this project was received from Crown-Indigenous and Northern Affairs Canada (Government of Canada) through the Indigenous Community-Based Climate Monitoring Program. Climate stations were purchased from Forest Technology Systems Inc headquatered in British Columbia, Canada.

notes_translated.en: NEGL - Postville, Nunatsiavut (NLQU0001). Tri-leg tower masts are 25 feet tall (7.62 m) and stations are all located at mid-slopes in cleared terrain.  Sites at Cartwright Junction, near Red Bay and at North West River all include fence enclosures which may impact snow accumulation at these sites.  All stations are owned and operated by the Northern Environmental Geoscience Laboratory led by Dr. Robert Way. All stations were established in partnership with the communities of Black Tickle, North West River, Postville, Red Bay and Rigolet.  Support for this project was received from the Labrador Institute of Memorial University of Newfoundland, the Nunatsiavut Government, the NunatuKavut Community Council, the Government of Newfoundland and Labrador's Department of Fisheries and Land Resources & Department of Municipal Affairs and Environment, and Queen's University.  Funding for this project was received from Crown-Indigenous and Northern Affairs Canada (Government of Canada) through the Indigenous Community-Based Climate Monitoring Program. Climate stations were purchased from Forest Technology Systems Inc headquatered in British Columbia, Canada.
notes_translated.fr: NEGL - Postville, Nunatsiavut (NLQU0001). Les mâts de tour à trois pattes mesurent 25 pieds de hauteur (7,62 m) et les stations sont toutes situées à mi-pentes en terrain dégagé. Les sites de Cartwright Junction, près de Red Bay et de North West River comprennent tous des clôtures qui peuvent avoir une incidence sur l'accumulation de neige à ces sites. Toutes les stations sont détenues et exploitées par le Laboratoire géoscientifique de l'environnement du Nord dirigé par Robert Way. Toutes les stations ont été établies en partenariat avec les collectivités de Black Tickle, North West River, Postville, Red Bay et Rigolet. Le soutien de ce projet a été reçu du Labrador Institute of Memorial University of Newfoundland, du gouvernement du Nunatsiavut, du NunatuKavut Community Council, du ministère des Pêches et des Ressources foncières et du ministère des Affaires municipales et de l'Environnement du gouvernement de Terre-Neuve-et-Labrador et du ministère des Affaires municipales et de l'Environnement, et Queen's University. Le financement de ce projet a été reçu de la Couronne-Autochtones et du Nord Canada (gouvernement du Canada) dans le cadre du Programme de surveillance du climat axé sur les collectivités autochtones. Les stations climatiques ont été achetées auprès de Forest Technology Systems Inc, dont le siège social est situé en Colombie-Britannique, au Canada.

description_translated.fr:
CIOOS-Atlantic est un consortium d’institutions partenaires engagées dans le développement de la gestion et la diffusion des données océanographiques de la côte Atlantique, du Labrador à la frontière entre le Maine et le Nouveau-Brunswick.

La collaboration continue avec un large éventail de parties prenantes fait partie intégrante de CIOOS-Atlantique, et nous travaillerons pour répondre aux besoins de la communauté océanographique et veiller à ce que les intérêts régionaux soient représentés au niveau national. L'accent est mis sur la création d'un système qui facilite l'accès aux données afin de soutenir le travail des partenaires, chercheurs, industries, etc.
description_translated.en:
CIOOS-Atlantic is a consortium of partner institutions which are committed to the development of a data management and dissemination approach for oceanographic data from the Atlantic Seaboard, a region spanning from Labrador to the Maine / New Brunswick border.

Meaningful engagement and ongoing communication with a broad variety of stakeholders is an integral component of CIOOS-Atlantic, and we will work to meet the needs of the local oceanographic community and ensure regional interests are represented at the national level. Emphasis is placed on the creation of a system which promotes easy data access and supports the work of partners, researchers, industry, and more.

title: NEGL, Postville, Nunatsiavut (NLQU0001)
